entry.title: New release for bewCloud: v1.9.0
entry.content:
This includes SSO as an optional login/signup method via OIDC.

You'll need to be using the new bewcloud.config.ts file to set it up, and don't forget the new ENV vars (client id and client secret) in the .env file!

What's Changed

  • Implement (optional) SSO via OIDC (OpenID Connect) by @BrunoBernardino in https://github.com/bewcloud/bewcloud/pull/64

Full Changelog: https://github.com/bewcloud/bewcloud/compare/v1.8.0...v1.9.0

entry.title: New release for bewCloud: v2.0.0
entry.content:
This removes Brevo as an email provider, replacing it with a generic SMTP email provider instead.

It's a major release only because it includes a few breaking changes, specified below.

Breaking changes

  • Brevo API Key no longer supported (now you have SMTP_USERNAME and SMTP_PASSWORD in the .env file, and config.email in bewcloud.config.ts)
  • ENV-based config (you use .env for some secrets, but configuration now resides in bewcloud.config.ts)
  • PostgreSQL upgrade (from 15 to 17 â€” configuration-only, nothing changed in terms of SQL or use)

What to do if the breaking changes affect you?

If you were using Brevo with an API Key, they support SMTP as well, just check your account-specific values and update your .env and bewcloud.config.ts files.

If you were still using the deprecated ENV-based config, check bewcloud.config.sample.ts to create your bewcloud.config.ts.

If you need help upgrading you PostgreSQL container, I've written a simple step-by-step guide. Alternatively, you can keep it at 15 as well for a little while longer.

What's Changed

  • Migrate email provider (from Brevo to generic SMTP) by @BrunoBernardino in https://github.com/bewcloud/bewcloud/pull/67

Full Changelog: https://github.com/bewcloud/bewcloud/compare/v1.9.2...v2.0.0

entry.title: New release for bewCloud: v2.1.0
